org.jsonschema2pojo.ant

Class Jsonschema2PojoTask

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.tools.ant.ProjectComponent
      • org.apache.tools.ant.Task
        • org.jsonschema2pojo.ant.Jsonschema2PojoTask
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Cloneable, GenerationConfig

    public class Jsonschema2PojoTask
extends org.apache.tools.ant.Task
implements GenerationConfig
    When invoked, this task reads one or more JSON Schema documents and generates DTO style Java classes for data binding.

    See jsonschema2pojo.googlecode.com.

    See Also:
    Writing Your Own Task

      • execute

        public void execute()
             throws org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException
        Execute this task (it's expected that all relevant setters will have been called by Ant to provide task configuration before this method is called).
        Overrides:
        execute in class org.apache.tools.ant.Task
        Throws:
        org.apache.tools.ant.BuildException - if this task cannot be completed due to some error reading schemas, generating types or writing output .java files.

      • setGenerateBuilders

        public void setGenerateBuilders(boolean generateBuilders)
        Sets the 'generateBuilders' property of this class.
        Parameters:
        generateBuilders - Whether to generate builder-style methods of the form withXxx(value) (that return this), alongside the standard, void-return setters.

        Default: false.

      • setUsePrimitives

        public void setUsePrimitives(boolean usePrimitives)
        Sets the 'usePrimitives' property of this class.
        Parameters:
        usePrimitives - Whether to use primitives (long, double , boolean) instead of wrapper types where possible when generating bean properties (has the side-effect of making those properties non-null).

        Default: false.

      • setUseLongIntegers

        public void setUseLongIntegers(boolean useLongIntegers)
        Sets the 'useLongIntegers' property of this class
        Parameters:
        useLongIntegers - Whether to use the java type long (or Long) instead of int (or Integer) when representing the JSON Schema type 'integer'.

      • setUseDoubleNumbers

        public void setUseDoubleNumbers(boolean useDoubleNumbers)
        Sets the 'useDoubleNumbers' property of this class
        Parameters:
        useDoubleNumbers - Whether to use the java type double (or Double) instead of float (or Float) when representing the JSON Schema type 'number'.

        public void setSource(File source)
        Sets schema file (or directory containing schema files) that should be used for input.
        Parameters:

      • setTargetPackage

        public void setTargetPackage(String targetPackage)
        Sets the target package for generated types.
        Parameters:
        targetPackage - Package name used for generated Java classes (for types where a fully qualified name has not been supplied in the schema using the 'javaType' property).

      • setSkip

        public void setSkip(boolean skip)
        Sets the 'skip' property of this task.
        Parameters:
        skip - whether to skip execution of this task

      • setPropertyWordDelimiters

        public void setPropertyWordDelimiters(String propertyWordDelimiters)
        Parameters:
        propertyWordDelimiters - a string containing all of the characters that should be considered as word delimiters when creating Java Bean property names from JSON property names. If blank or not set, JSON properties will be considered to contain a single word when creating Java Bean property names.

      • setIncludeHashcodeAndEquals

        public void setIncludeHashcodeAndEquals(boolean includeHashcodeAndEquals)
        Sets the 'includeHashcodeAndEquals' property of this class
        Parameters:
        includeHashcodeAndEquals - Whether to include hashCode and equals methods in generated Java types.

        Sets the 'includeJsr303Annotations' property of this class
        Parameters:
        includeJsr303Annotations - Whether to include JSR-303 annotations (for schema rules like minimum, maximum, etc) in generated Java types.

      • setSourceType

        public void setSourceType(SourceType sourceType)
        Sets the 'sourceType' property of this class
        Parameters:
        sourceType - The type of input documents that will be read

        Supported values:

        • jsonschema
        • json

      • setRemoveOldOutput

        public void setRemoveOldOutput(boolean removeOldOutput)
        Sets the 'removeOldOutput' property of this class
        Parameters:
        removeOldOutput - Whether to empty the target directory before generation occurs, to clear out all source files that have been generated previously. Be warned, when activated this option will cause jsonschema2pojo to indiscriminately delete the entire contents of the target directory (all files and folders) before it begins generating sources.

      • setOutputEncoding

        public void setOutputEncoding(String outputEncoding)
        Sets the 'outputEncoding' property of this class
        Parameters:
        outputEncoding - The character encoding that should be used when writing the generated Java source files

      • setUseJodaDates

        public void setUseJodaDates(boolean useJodaDates)
        Sets the 'useJodaDates' property of this class
        Parameters:
        useJodaDates - Whether to use DateTime instead of Date when adding date type fields to generated Java types.

      • setUseCommonsLang3

        public void setUseCommonsLang3(boolean useCommonsLang3)
        Sets the 'useCommonsLang3' property of this class
        Parameters:
        useCommonsLang3 - Whether to use commons-lang 3.x imports instead of commons-lang 2.x imports when adding equals, hashCode and toString methods.

      • getAnnotationStyle

        public AnnotationStyle getAnnotationStyle()
        Description copied from interface: GenerationConfig
        Gets the 'annotationStyle' configuration option.
        Specified by:
        getAnnotationStyle in interface GenerationConfig
        Returns:
        The style of annotations to use in the generated Java types.

        Supported values:

        • jackson1 (apply annotations from the Jackson 1.x library)
        • jackson2 (apply annotations from the Jackson 2.x library)
        • gson (apply annotations from the gson library)
        • none (apply no annotations at all)
        See Also:
        AnnotatorFactory
